cobolprettyheaders.setHighestLevelNumber.description: Enter the highest level number you'd like for header field definitions.

cobolprettyheaders.setLowestLevelNumber.description: Enter the lowest level number you'd like for the sub-fields in the header definition. Note that this must be lower than the highest level number.

cobolprettyheaders.condensedHeaders.description: Check to change header data fields to condensed, condensed data fields will store each full line of the header in a single data field instead of separate ones for each word and space.

cobolprettyheaders.setPrintOutputField.description: Set the name of the output for the header write procedure, default is set to 'output'

cobolprettyheaders.setHeaderNames.description: Enter preferred name for each header line data definition. The '-HDR' suffix will be added automatically to entered names. Note if there are more header lines than user given names, a default name will be provided.

cobolprettyheaders.setDefaultNamePrefix.description: Enter a string that will be used to create default header names. Example: if you put 'my-header', the resulting default names will be 'my-header1-HDR, my-header2-HDR, ...etc.
